item.title: Learning jax
item.description: After spending several hours reading jax’s documentation1 I have finally grasped the basic idea of it. I will try to summarize it in words. It is built upon an elegant concept which I call function reinterpretation. The idea is that, given an unknown implementation of a function, one can define a transformation that reinterprets the implementation of the function without knowing its details as long as the underlying function is composable of a well-defined set of primitive functions that we have provided.

item.title: Cosmic Birefringence
item.description: A compilation of works in the literature related to cosmic birefringence.
